title: (x) deco/20's style serif face - Solid Antique Roman {Franz}
content: I am helping a friend make a wedding invitation and they have submitted to me a font that they would like to use (or something very similar). It is listed as SAR. I can't find it anywhere on the web. It is a very elongated serif font, with a deco/20's feel to it. I have been to many sites and still can not find it. If it helps, all of the lower case letters have the same cap height with acsenders as tall as upper case cap height.
author: spidey083176

comments.content:
Edit:   
Nevermind, I see you have already posted a sample...

Yes, the scan _does_ help.. It's [Solid Antique Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175603/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/solid-antique-roman/) ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175603im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

This is an old metal foundry typeface called Typo Roman. I'm sure there is a digital version of this somewhere, but I checked the usual sources and couldn't find it. No doubt it's traveling under an assumed name.
If this were a duel with guns you would be Clint Eastwood, Franz! Always too fast. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175603im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
